etymologies: Old English rib, ribb (noun), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch rib(be) and German Rippe. Sense 1 of the verb dates from the mid 16th century; the sense ‘tease’ was originally a US slang usage meaning ‘to fool, dupe’ (1930s)

definitions: each of a series of slender curved bones articulated in pairs to the spine (twelve pairs in humans), protecting the thoracic cavity and its organs
shortDefinitions: each of series of slender curved bones articulated in pairs to spine twelve pairs in humans

definitions: a rib of an animal with meat adhering to it used as food; a joint or cut from the ribs of an animal

examples.text: a lunch of ribs, wings, and blueberry pie

shortDefinitions: rib of animal with meat adhering to it used as food

definitions: a long raised piece of stronger or thicker material across a surface or through a structure, and typically serving to support or strengthen it.
shortDefinitions: long raised piece of strengthening or supporting material

definitions: a curved member supporting a vault or defining its form

examples.text: stone is used only for ribs, piers, and windows

shortDefinitions: curved member supporting vault or defining its form

definitions: any of the curved transverse pieces of metal or timber in a ship, extending up from the keel and forming part of the framework of the hull

examples.text: the hull was stiffened with 26 ribs

shortDefinitions: curved transverse strut of metal or timber in ship

definitions: each of the curved pieces of wood forming the body of a lute or the sides of a violin.
shortDefinitions: each of curved pieces of wood forming body of lute

definitions: each of the hinged rods supporting the fabric of an umbrella.
shortDefinitions: each of hinged rods supporting fabric of umbrella

definitions: a structural member in an airfoil, extending back from the leading edge and serving to define the contour of the airfoil.
shortDefinitions: structural member in aerofoil, extending back from leading edge

definitions: a ridge of rock or land

examples.text: the final rib gives pleasant climbing

definitions: a vein of a leaf (especially the midrib) or an insect's wing

examples.text: a spinach-type leaf with red ribs

shortDefinitions: vein of leaf or insect's wing

definitions: a combination of alternate knit (plain) and purl stitches producing a ridged, slightly elastic fabric, used especially for the cuffs and bottom edges of sweaters
shortDefinitions: combination of alternate plain and purl stitches producing ridged

definitions: mark with or form into raised bands or ridges

examples.text: the road ahead was ribbed with furrows of slush

shortDefinitions: mark with or form into ridges

examples.text: the first time I appeared in the outfit I was ribbed mercilessly
